class_uid: Integer: Required: Must be 2005 for Incident Finding.
finding_uid: String: Required: Unique identifier of the incident finding.
title: String: Required: Short human-readable title describing the finding.
desc: String: Optional: Detailed description of the incident finding.
severity_id: Integer: Optional: Numeric severity level as defined by OCSF.
status_id: Integer: Optional: Numeric status code of the finding (e.g., New, In Progress, Closed).
confidence: Integer: Optional: Confidence score (0â€“100) indicating likelihood the finding is valid.
created_time: Timestamp String: Optional: Time when the finding record was created.
first_seen_time: Timestamp String: Optional: Time when the incident was first observed.
last_seen_time: Timestamp String: Optional: Time when the incident was most recently observed.
modified_time: Timestamp String: Optional: Time when the finding record was last modified.
types: Array of String: Optional: One or more classifications describing the nature or source of the finding.

product.name: String: Optional: Name of the product or system that generated the finding.
product.uid: String: Optional: Unique identifier of the product.

related_events: Array of String: Optional: UIDs of events related to this incident.
references: Array of String: Optional: URLs or external references for the finding.
supporting_data: String: Optional: Free-form supporting information or evidence.

remediation.desc: String: Optional: Description of how the incident was or should be remediated.

metadata.uid: String: Optional: Original finding UID in the source system.
metadata.activity_id: String: Optional: Identifier of the rule, playbook, or activity that generated the finding.

custom_attributes.comments: Array: Optional: Array of objects with fields 'author', 'timestamp', 'text' representing analyst comments.
custom_attributes.tlp: Integer: Optional: Traffic Light Protocol classification. Default: 2.
custom_attributes.tasks: Array: Optional: Workflow or response tasks associated with the finding.
custom_attributes.observables: Array: Optional: Objects describing observed artifacts (e.g., IPs, hashes, domains) with fields like 'type' and 'value'.
custom_attributes.customFields: Object: Optional: Arbitrary key-value pairs for vendor-specific or workflow-specific fields.
custom_attributes.assignee: String: Optional: Email or identifier of the analyst or system responsible for the finding.
custom_attributes.attachments: Array: Optional: Files or artifacts attached to the finding, such as reports, screenshots, or logs.
